translations.chinese: 孔子曰「受業身通者七十有七人」，皆異能之士也。
translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Those who received teachings and were personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all men of exceptional abilities.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Those who received my teachings and became personally proficient numbered seventy-seven people,' all exceptional men.

context.next: 德行：顏淵，閔子騫，冉伯牛，仲弓。

translations.chinese: 德行：顏淵，閔子騫，冉伯牛，仲弓。
translations.literal: Moral conduct: Yan Yuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhong Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Virtue: Yanyuan, Min Ziqian, Ran Boniu, Zhonggong.

context.previous: 孔子曰「受業身通者七十有七人」，皆異能之士也。
context.next: 政事：冉有，季路。

translations.literal: Governance: Ran You, Ji Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Government: Ranyou, Jilu.

context.previous: 德行：顏淵，閔子騫，冉伯牛，仲弓。
context.next: 言語：宰我，子貢。

translations.literal: Eloquence: Zai Wo, Zi Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Speech: Zaiwo, Zigong.

context.previous: 政事：冉有，季路。
context.next: 文學：子游，子夏。

translations.literal: Scholarship: Zi You, Zi Xia.
translations.idiomatic: Literature: Ziyou, Zixia.

context.previous: 言語：宰我，子貢。
context.next: 師也辟，參也魯，柴也愚，由也喭，回也屢空。

translations.chinese: 師也辟，參也魯，柴也愚，由也喭，回也屢空。
translations.literal: Shi is dissolute, Shen is dull, Chai is foolish, You is crude, Hui is often empty.
translations.idiomatic: Shi was dissolute, Shen dull, Chai foolish, You crude, Hui often empty.

context.previous: 文學：子游，子夏。
context.next: 賜不受命而貨殖焉，億則屢中。

translations.chinese: 賜不受命而貨殖焉，億則屢中。
translations.literal: Ci did not accept office but engaged in commerce, his speculations often hit the mark.
translations.idiomatic: Ci refused office to engage in trade, where his speculations often proved accurate.

context.previous: 師也辟，參也魯，柴也愚，由也喭，回也屢空。

translations.chinese: 孔子之所嚴事：於周則老子；
translations.literal: Those whom Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Zi;
translations.idiomatic: Those Confucius treated with respect: in Zhou, Lao Tzu;

context.next: 於衛，蘧伯玉；

translations.literal: in Wei, Qu Bo Yu;
translations.idiomatic: in Wey, Qu Boyu;

context.previous: 孔子之所嚴事：於周則老子；
context.next: 於齊，晏平仲；

translations.literal: in Qi, Yan Ping Zhong;
translations.idiomatic: in Ch'i, Yan Tzu;

context.previous: 於衛，蘧伯玉；
context.next: 於楚，老萊子；

translations.literal: in Chu, Lao Lai Zi;
translations.idiomatic: in Chu, Lao Laizi;

context.previous: 於齊，晏平仲；
context.next: 於鄭，子產；

translations.literal: in Zheng, Zi Chan;
translations.idiomatic: in Zheng, Zichan;

context.previous: 於楚，老萊子；
context.next: 於魯，孟公綽。

translations.literal: in Lu, Meng Gong Chuo.
translations.idiomatic: in Lu, Meng Gongchuo.

context.previous: 於鄭，子產；
context.next: 數稱臧文仲、柳下惠、銅鞮伯華、介山子然，孔子皆後之，不并世。

translations.chinese: 數稱臧文仲、柳下惠、銅鞮伯華、介山子然，孔子皆後之，不并世。
translations.literal: He frequently praised Zang Wen Zhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bo Hua, Jie Shan Zi Ran, Confucius all came after them, not contemporaries.
translations.idiomatic: He frequently praised Zang Wenzhong, Liu Xia Hui, Tong Di Bohua, Jie Shan Ziran. Confucius all came after them and was not their contemporary.

context.previous: 於魯，孟公綽。

translations.literal: Yan Hui was a Lu man, styled Zi Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Hui was a man from Lu, styled Ziyuan.

context.next: 少孔子三十歲。

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by thirty years.
translations.idiomatic: He was thirty years younger than Confucius.

context.previous: 顏回者，魯人也，字子淵。

translations.chinese: 顏淵問仁，孔子曰：「克己復禮，天下歸仁焉。」
translations.literal: Yan Yuan asked about benevolence, Confucius said: 'Conquer self and return to ritual, all under Heaven will return to benevolence.'
translations.idiomatic: Yanyuan asked about benevolence. Confucius said: 'Conquer the self and return to ritual. Then all under Heaven will achieve benevolence.'

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Worthy indeed is Hui!
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'How worthy Hui is!

context.next: 一簞食，一瓢飲，在陋巷，人不堪其憂，回也不改其樂。」

translations.chinese: 一簞食，一瓢飲，在陋巷，人不堪其憂，回也不改其樂。」
translations.literal: One basket of food, one gourd of drink, in a humble lane, others cannot bear his worries, Hui does not change his joy.'
translations.idiomatic: A single basket of food, a single gourd of drink, dwelling in a humble lane—others cannot bear such hardship, yet Hui does not change his joy.''

context.previous: 孔子曰：「賢哉回也！
context.next: 「回也如愚；

translations.literal: 'Hui appears foolish;
translations.idiomatic: 'Hui seems foolish on the surface,

context.previous: 一簞食，一瓢飲，在陋巷，人不堪其憂，回也不改其樂。」
context.next: 退而省其私，亦足以發，回也不愚。」

translations.chinese: 退而省其私，亦足以發，回也不愚。」
translations.literal: when he withdraws and examines his private thoughts, it is sufficient to inspire, Hui is not foolish.'
translations.idiomatic: but when he withdraws to reflect on his inner thoughts, it is more than enough to inspire others. Hui is not foolish.''

context.previous: 「回也如愚；
context.next: 「用之則行，捨之則藏，唯我與爾有是夫！」

translations.chinese: 「用之則行，捨之則藏，唯我與爾有是夫！」
translations.literal: 'When employed then act, when discarded then hide, only I and you have this!'
translations.idiomatic: 'When called upon, he acts; when set aside, he withdraws. Only I and you possess this quality!'

context.previous: 退而省其私，亦足以發，回也不愚。」

translations.chinese: 回年二十九，發盡白，蚤死。
translations.literal: Hui at age twenty-nine, hair all white, died young.
translations.idiomatic: Hui died at age twenty-nine, his hair completely white from overwork.

context.next: 孔子哭之慟，曰：「自吾有回，門人益親。」

translations.chinese: 孔子哭之慟，曰：「自吾有回，門人益親。」
translations.literal: Confucius wept for him in great sorrow, said: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have become more intimate.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius wept for him with great sorrow, saying: 'Since I had Hui, my disciples have drawn closer to me.'

context.previous: 回年二十九，發盡白，蚤死。

translations.chinese: 魯哀公問：「弟子孰為好學？」
translations.literal: Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which disciple is diligent in study?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai of Lu asked: 'Which of your disciples is the most diligent in learning?'

context.next: 孔子對曰：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過。

translations.chinese: 孔子對曰：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過。
translations.literal: Confucius replied: 'There is Yan Hui who is diligent in study, does not transfer anger, does not repeat errors.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius replied: 'There is Yanyuan, who is diligent in learning. He does not transfer his anger to others, nor does he repeat his mistakes.

context.previous: 魯哀公問：「弟子孰為好學？」
context.next: 不幸短命死矣，今也則亡。」

translations.chinese: 不幸短命死矣，今也則亡。」
translations.literal: Unfortunately died young, now there is none.'
translations.idiomatic: Unfortunately he died young. Now there is no one like him.''

context.previous: 孔子對曰：「有顏回者好學，不遷怒，不貳過。

translations.literal: Min Sun styled Zi Qian.
translations.idiomatic: Min Sun was styled Ziqian.

context.next: 少孔子十五歲。

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by fifteen years.
translations.idiomatic: He was fifteen years younger than Confucius.

context.previous: 閔損字子騫。

translations.literal: Confucius said: 'Filial indeed is Min Zi Qian!
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'How filial Min Ziqian is!

context.next: 人不閒於其父母昆弟之言。」

translations.chinese: 人不閒於其父母昆弟之言。」
translations.literal: People do not find fault in the words of his parents and brothers.'
translations.idiomatic: People do not find fault with what his parents and siblings say.''

context.previous: 孔子曰：「孝哉閔子騫！
context.next: 不仕大夫，不食汙君之祿。

translations.chinese: 不仕大夫，不食汙君之祿。
translations.literal: Did not serve grand masters, did not eat the salary of corrupt rulers.
translations.idiomatic: Did not serve grand masters, nor eat corrupt rulers' salary.

context.previous: 人不閒於其父母昆弟之言。」
context.next: 「如有復我者，必在汶上矣。」

translations.literal: 'If there are those who call me back, it must be above the Wen.'
translations.idiomatic: 'If anyone calls me back, it will surely be from above the Wen River.''

context.previous: 不仕大夫，不食汙君之祿。

translations.literal: Ran Geng styled Bo Niu.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Geng was styled Boniu.

context.next: 孔子以為有德行。

translations.literal: Confucius considered him to have moral conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius considered him to possess virtue.

context.previous: 冉耕字伯牛。

translations.chinese: 伯牛有惡疾，孔子往問之，自牖執其手，曰：「命也夫！
translations.literal: Bo Niu had a serious illness, Confucius went to visit him, from the window grasped his hand, said: 'Fate it is!
translations.idiomatic: Boniu had a serious illness. Confucius went to visit him and grasped his hand through the window, saying: 'It is fate!

context.next: 斯人也而有斯疾，命也夫！」

translations.chinese: 斯人也而有斯疾，命也夫！」
translations.literal: This person has this illness, fate it is!'
translations.idiomatic: Such a person to have such an illness—it is fate!''

context.previous: 伯牛有惡疾，孔子往問之，自牖執其手，曰：「命也夫！

translations.literal: Ran Yong styled Zhong Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Yong was styled Zhonggong.

translations.chinese: 仲弓問政，孔子曰：「出門如見大賓，使民如承大祭。
translations.literal: Zhong Gong asked about governance, Confucius said: 'When going out treat as meeting great guests, when employing people treat as conducting great sacrifice.
translations.idiomatic: Zhonggong asked about governance. Confucius said: 'When going abroad, treat it as meeting great guests. When employing the people, treat it as conducting a great sacrifice.

context.next: 在邦無怨，在家無怨。」

translations.literal: In the state no resentment, in the home no resentment.'
translations.idiomatic: No resentment in state, no resentment at home.''

context.previous: 仲弓問政，孔子曰：「出門如見大賓，使民如承大祭。

translations.chinese: 孔子以仲弓為有德行，曰：「雍也可使南面。」
translations.literal: Confucius considered Zhong Gong to have moral conduct, said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'
translations.idiomatic: Confucius considered Zhonggong to possess virtue and said: 'Yong can be made to face south.'

translations.literal: Zhong Gong's father was a commoner.
translations.idiomatic: Zhonggong's father was of humble birth.

context.next: 孔子曰：「犁牛之子騂且角，雖欲勿用，山川其舍諸？」

translations.chinese: 孔子曰：「犁牛之子騂且角，雖欲勿用，山川其舍諸？」
translations.literal: Confucius said: "The son of a plow ox is reddish and has horns, though one wishes not to use it, will the mountains and rivers abandon it?"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'The calf of a plow ox is reddish and has horns. Though one might wish not to use it, would the mountains and rivers reject it?'

context.previous: 仲弓父，賤人。

translations.chinese: 冉求字子有，少孔子二十九歲。
translations.literal: Ran Qiu styled Ziyou, younger than Confucius by twenty-nine years.
translations.idiomatic: Ran Qiu was styled Ziyou. He was twenty-nine years younger than Confucius.

context.next: 為季氏宰。

translations.literal: Served as steward for the Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: He served as steward for the Ji clan.

context.previous: 冉求字子有，少孔子二十九歲。

translations.chinese: 季康子問孔子曰：「冉求仁乎？」
translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked Confucius: "Is Ran Qiu benevolent?"
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kangzi asked Confucius: 'Is Ran Qiu benevolent?'

context.next: 曰：「千室之邑，百乘之家，求也可使治其賦。

translations.chinese: 曰：「千室之邑，百乘之家，求也可使治其賦。
translations.literal: Said: "For a town of a thousand households, a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their taxes.
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'For a town of a thousand households or a family with a hundred chariots, Qiu can be made to manage their revenues.

context.previous: 季康子問孔子曰：「冉求仁乎？」
context.next: 仁則吾不知也。」

translations.literal: As for benevolence, I do not know."
translations.idiomatic: As for benevolence, I do not know.''

context.previous: 曰：「千室之邑，百乘之家，求也可使治其賦。
context.next: 復問：「子路仁乎？」

translations.literal: Asked again: "Is Zi Lu benevolent?"
translations.idiomatic: He asked again: 'Is Zilu benevolent?'

context.previous: 仁則吾不知也。」
context.next: 孔子對曰：「如求。」

translations.literal: Confucius replied: "Like Qiu."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius replied: 'Like Qiu.'

context.previous: 復問：「子路仁乎？」

translations.literal: Qiu asked: "Having heard, act on it?"
translations.idiomatic: Qiu asked: 'Having heard this, should one act on it?'

context.next: 子曰：「行之。」

translations.literal: The Master said: "Act."
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'Act on it.'

context.previous: 求問曰：「聞斯行諸？」
context.next: 子路問：「聞斯行諸？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu asked: "Having heard, act on it?"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu asked: 'Having heard this, should one act on it?'

context.previous: 子曰：「行之。」
context.next: 子曰：「有父兄在，如之何其聞斯行之！」

translations.chinese: 子曰：「有父兄在，如之何其聞斯行之！」
translations.literal: The Master said: "With father and elder brothers present, how can one having heard act on it!"
translations.idiomatic: The Master said: 'If one's father and elder brothers are still alive, how can one act on something one has heard?'

context.previous: 子路問：「聞斯行諸？」
context.next: 子華怪之，「敢問問同而答異？」

translations.chinese: 子華怪之，「敢問問同而答異？」
translations.literal: Zi Hua was puzzled, "Dare ask why questions same but answers different?"
translations.idiomatic: Zihua was puzzled and asked: 'May I ask why the questions were the same but the answers different?'

context.previous: 子曰：「有父兄在，如之何其聞斯行之！」
context.next: 孔子曰：「求也退，故進之。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Qiu retreats, therefore advance him.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Qiu is hesitant, so I encourage him forward.

context.previous: 子華怪之，「敢問問同而答異？」
context.next: 由也兼人，故退之。」

translations.literal: You is overbearing, therefore restrain him."
translations.idiomatic: You is overbearing, so I hold him back.'

context.previous: 孔子曰：「求也退，故進之。

translations.literal: Zhong You styled Zi Lu, a Bian man.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong You, whose courtesy name was Zilu, was a man from Bian.

context.next: 少孔子九歲。

translations.literal: Younger than Confucius by nine years.
translations.idiomatic: He was nine years younger than Confucius.

context.previous: 仲由字子路，卞人也。

translations.chinese: 子路性鄙，好勇力，志伉直，冠雄雞，佩豭豚，陵暴孔子。
translations.literal: Zi Lu nature was coarse, fond of bravery and strength, his will upright and unyielding, wore a cap with fighting cock, carried a piglet sword, bullied Confucius.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu had a coarse nature. He loved courage and physical strength. His ambitions were upright and unyielding. He wore a cap decorated with a fighting cock and carried a sword with a piglet hilt. He bullied Confucius.

context.next: 孔子設禮稍誘子路，子路後儒服委質，因門人請為弟子。

translations.chinese: 孔子設禮稍誘子路，子路後儒服委質，因門人請為弟子。
translations.literal: Confucius established ritual to gradually guide Zi Lu, Zi Lu later wore Confucian robes and presented introductory gifts, became a disciple.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius used ritual to gradually entice Zilu. Later, Zilu donned Confucian robes and presented the introductory gifts. Through his disciples, he requested to become a student.

context.previous: 子路性鄙，好勇力，志伉直，冠雄雞，佩豭豚，陵暴孔子。

translations.chinese: 子路問政，孔子曰：「先之，勞之。」
translations.literal: Zi Lu asked about governance, Confucius said: "Lead them, labor them."
translations.idiomatic: Zilu asked about governing. Confucius said: 'Lead them. Make them work.'

context.next: 請益。

translations.literal: Requested more.
translations.idiomatic: He asked for more advice.

context.previous: 子路問政，孔子曰：「先之，勞之。」
context.next: 曰：「無倦。」

translations.literal: Said: "Do not tire."
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Do not grow weary.'

context.previous: 請益。

translations.literal: Zi Lu asked: "Does the gentleman value bravery?"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu asked: 'Does the gentleman prize courage?'

context.next: 孔子曰：「義之為上。

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Righteousness is paramount.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Righteousness is the highest virtue.

context.previous: 子路問：「君子尚勇乎？」
context.next: 君子好勇而無義則亂，小人好勇而無義則盜。」

translations.chinese: 君子好勇而無義則亂，小人好勇而無義則盜。」
translations.literal: If a gentleman loves bravery but lacks righteousness then chaos, if a petty man loves bravery but lacks righteousness then theft."
translations.idiomatic: If a gentleman loves courage but lacks righteousness, he will cause disorder. If a petty man loves courage but lacks righteousness, he will become a bandit.'

context.previous: 孔子曰：「義之為上。

translations.chinese: 子路有聞，未之能行，唯恐有聞。
translations.literal: Zi Lu upon hearing, feared not being able to practice, only feared not hearing.
translations.idiomatic: When Zilu heard something, he feared he would not be able to practice it. His only fear was not hearing it.

translations.chinese: 孔子曰：「片言可以折獄者，其由也與！」
translations.literal: Confucius said: "One who can judge cases with a single phrase, it is You!"
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'The one who can resolve legal disputes with just a single statement—that would be You!'

context.next: 「由也好勇過我，無所取材。」

translations.literal: "You loves bravery exceeding me, nothing to take as material."
translations.idiomatic: 'You loves courage more than I do, but there's nothing to be gained from it.'

context.previous: 孔子曰：「片言可以折獄者，其由也與！」
context.next: 「若由也，不得其死然。」

translations.literal: "If You, will not obtain proper death."
translations.idiomatic: 'As for You, he will not die a natural death.'

context.previous: 「由也好勇過我，無所取材。」
context.next: 「衣敝縕袍，與衣狐貉者立，而不恥者，其由也與！」

translations.chinese: 「衣敝縕袍，與衣狐貉者立，而不恥者，其由也與！」
translations.literal: "One who wears ragged silk robe, stands with those wearing fox and badger furs without shame, it is You!"
translations.idiomatic: 'The one who wears a tattered silk robe and stands among those dressed in fox and badger furs without feeling ashamed—that would be You!'

context.previous: 「若由也，不得其死然。」
context.next: 「由也升堂矣，未入於室也。」

translations.literal: "You has ascended the hall, has not yet entered the inner chamber."
translations.idiomatic: 'You has entered the main hall but not yet reached the inner chambers.'

context.previous: 「衣敝縕袍，與衣狐貉者立，而不恥者，其由也與！」

translations.literal: Ji Kang Zi asked: "Is Zhong You benevolent?"
translations.idiomatic: Ji Kangzi asked: 'Is Zhong You benevolent?'

context.next: 孔子曰：「千乘之國可使治其賦，不知其仁。」

translations.chinese: 孔子曰：「千乘之國可使治其賦，不知其仁。」
translations.literal: Confucius said: "For a state of thousand chariots he can be made to manage taxes, do not know his benevolence."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'For a state with a thousand chariots, he could be put in charge of tax collection. I do not know about his benevolence.'

context.previous: 季康子問：「仲由仁乎？」

translations.chinese: 子路喜從游，遇長沮、桀溺、荷蓧丈人。
translations.literal: Zi Lu delighted in following on excursions, encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, He Tao Elder.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu loved accompanying Confucius on his travels. He encountered Chang Ju, Jie Ni, and the old man carrying a basket.

translations.chinese: 子路為季氏宰，季孫問曰：「子路可謂大臣與？」
translations.literal: Zi Lu served as steward for Ji clan, Ji Sun asked: "Can Zi Lu be called a great minister?"
translations.idiomatic: Zilu served as steward for the Ji family. Jisun asked: 'Can Zilu be called a great minister?'

context.next: 孔子曰：「可謂具臣矣。」

translations.literal: Confucius said: "Can be called a complete minister."
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'He can be called a capable minister.'

context.previous: 子路為季氏宰，季孫問曰：「子路可謂大臣與？」

translations.literal: Zi Lu served as magistrate of Pu, took leave from Confucius.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu became magistrate of Pu and took his leave from Confucius.

context.next: 孔子曰：「蒲多壯士，又難治。

translations.chinese: 孔子曰：「蒲多壯士，又難治。
translations.literal: Confucius said: "Pu has many strong men, moreover difficult to govern.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'Pu has many strong men, and it is difficult to govern.

context.previous: 子路為蒲大夫，辭孔子。
context.next: 然吾語汝：恭以敬，可以執勇；

translations.chinese: 然吾語汝：恭以敬，可以執勇；

translations.idiomatic: Ying refused, saying: 'The son of the exiled crown prince, Zhe, is still here.'

translations.idiomatic: Therefore Wei established Zhe as ruler. He was known as Duke Chu.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu ruled for twelve years. His father Kuitun lived outside the state and could not enter.

translations.literal: Zi Lu served as magistrate of Kong Kui yi for Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zilu served as magistrate of the town belonging to Kong Kui, a Wei grandee.

translations.idiomatic: Kuitun then joined Kong Kui in rebellion. They planned to enter Kong Kui's house and then led their followers in a surprise attack on Duke Chu.

translations.idiomatic: Duke Chu fled to Lu, while Kuitun entered the capital and established himself as ruler. He was known as Duke Zhuang.

translations.idiomatic: When Kong Kui began his rebellion, Zilu was outside the city. He heard about it and galloped back.

translations.idiomatic: He met Zigao leaving the Wei city gate, who told Zilu: 'Duke Chu has fled, and the gates are already closed. You should turn back and not needlessly court disaster.'

context.next: 子路曰：「食其食者不避其難。」

translations.literal: Zi Lu said: "One who eats his food does not avoid his difficulties."
translations.idiomatic: Zilu said: 'One who eats his master's food does not shirk his master's troubles.'

context.previous: 遇子羔出衛城門，謂子路曰：「出公去矣，而門已閉，子可還矣，毋空受其禍。」

translations.literal: Zi Gao finally left.
translations.idiomatic: Zigao finally left.

translations.idiomatic: He approached Kuitun, who had ascended a tower with Kong Kui.

translations.idiomatic: Zilu said: 'Why does the ruler need Kong Kui?

translations.literal: Please obtain and kill him."
translations.idiomatic: Please let me get him and kill him.'

translations.literal: Kui Tun not listened.

translations.idiomatic: When Confucius heard of the chaos in Wei, he said: 'Alas, You has died!'

translations.literal: Zai Wo left, Master said: "Yu not benevolent!
translations.idiomatic: After Zaiwo left, the Master said: 'Yu is not benevolent!'

translations.idiomatic: Zigong had a sharp tongue and clever speech. Confucius often suppressed his eloquence.

translations.idiomatic: He asked: 'Which of you and Hui is better?'

translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'How dare Ci hope to equal Hui!'

translations.literal: Hui hears one knows ten, Ci hears one knows two."
translations.idiomatic: 'Hui hears one thing and understands ten. Ci hears one thing and understands two.'

translations.idiomatic: After Zigong had received his teachings, he asked: 'What kind of person is Ci?'

translations.idiomatic: He said: 'A sacrificial vessel.'

translations.idiomatic: Chen Ziqin asked Zigong: 'Where did Zhongni study?'

translations.literal: Master where not learn, moreover what constant teacher have!"
translations.idiomatic: The Master learns from everyone. What constant teacher does he have!'

translations.idiomatic: He asked again: 'Whenever Confucius goes to a state, he always hears about its governance.

translations.idiomatic: Confucius said: 'That is acceptable;

translations.idiomatic: but it is not as good as being poor yet joyful in the Way, or rich yet fond of ritual.'

translations.idiomatic: Zigong requested to go, and Confucius permitted him.

context.previous: 子張、子石請行，孔子弗許。

translations.chinese: 遂行，至齊，說田常曰：「君之伐魯過矣。
translations.literal: Then went, arrived Qi, advised Tian Chang: "Jun attack Lu wrong.
translations.idiomatic: He then went and arrived in Qi, where he advised Tian Chang: 'Your attack on Lu is a mistake.

context.next: 夫魯，難伐之國，其城薄以卑，其地狹以泄，其君愚而不仁，大臣偽而無用，其士民又惡甲兵之事，此不可與戰。

translations.chinese: 夫魯，難伐之國，其城薄以卑，其地狹以泄，其君愚而不仁，大臣偽而無用，其士民又惡甲兵之事，此不可與戰。
translations.literal: Lu, difficult attack country, its city thin with low, its land narrow with leaking, its jun foolish not benevolent, ministers false without use, its scholars people moreover hate armor weapons matters, this cannot battle with.
translations.idiomatic: Lu is a difficult country to attack. Its walls are thin and low, its land narrow and poorly defended. Its ruler is foolish and unkind, its ministers hypocritical and useless. Its scholars and people hate military affairs. This is not a country one can fight.'

context.previous: 遂行，至齊，說田常曰：「君之伐魯過矣。
context.next: 君不如伐吳。

translations.literal: Jun better attack Wu.
translations.idiomatic: You would do better to attack Wu.

context.previous: 夫魯，難伐之國，其城薄以卑，其地狹以泄，其君愚而不仁，大臣偽而無用，其士民又惡甲兵之事，此不可與戰。
context.next: 夫吳，城高以厚，地廣以深，甲堅以新，士選以飽，重器精兵盡在其中，又使明大夫守之，此易伐也。」

translations.chinese: 夫吳，城高以厚，地廣以深，甲堅以新，士選以飽，重器精兵盡在其中，又使明大夫守之，此易伐也。」
translations.literal: Wu, city high with thick, land broad with deep, armor firm with new, soldiers selected with full, heavy equipment elite troops all in midst, moreover make bright grand master guard it, this easy attack."
translations.idiomatic: Wu has high and thick walls, broad and deep territory. Its armor is firm and new, its soldiers selected and well-fed. All its heavy equipment and elite troops are concentrated there, and it is guarded by a wise grand master. This would be easy to attack.'

context.previous: 君不如伐吳。
context.next: 田常忿然作色曰：「子之所難，人之所易；

translations.chinese: 田常忿然作色曰：「子之所難，人之所易；
translations.literal: Tian Chang angrily changed color: "You what difficult, people what easy;
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang angrily changed color and said: 'What you find difficult, others find easy;'

context.previous: 夫吳，城高以厚，地廣以深，甲堅以新，士選以飽，重器精兵盡在其中，又使明大夫守之，此易伐也。」
context.next: 子之所易，人之所難：而以教常，何也？」

translations.chinese: 子之所易，人之所難：而以教常，何也？」
translations.literal: You what easy, people what difficult: with teach Chang, why?"
translations.idiomatic: 'what you find easy, others find difficult. Why do you teach this to Chang?'

context.previous: 田常忿然作色曰：「子之所難，人之所易；
context.next: 子貢曰：「臣聞之，憂在內者攻彊，憂在外者攻弱。

translations.chinese: 子貢曰：「臣聞之，憂在內者攻彊，憂在外者攻弱。
translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Subject heard, worry internal attack strong, worry external attack weak.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'I have heard that those whose worries are internal attack the strong, while those whose worries are external attack the weak.

context.previous: 子之所易，人之所難：而以教常，何也？」
context.next: 今君憂在內。

translations.literal: Now jun worry internal.
translations.idiomatic: Now your worries are internal.

context.previous: 子貢曰：「臣聞之，憂在內者攻彊，憂在外者攻弱。
context.next: 吾聞君三封而三不成者，大臣有不聽者也。

translations.chinese: 吾聞君三封而三不成者，大臣有不聽者也。
translations.literal: I heard jun three enfeoff three not succeed, ministers have not listen.
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that your three attempts at enfeoffment all failed because your ministers would not listen.'

context.previous: 今君憂在內。
context.next: 今君破魯以廣齊，戰勝以驕主，破國以尊臣，而君之功不與焉，則交日疏於主。

translations.chinese: 今君破魯以廣齊，戰勝以驕主，破國以尊臣，而君之功不與焉，則交日疏於主。
translations.literal: Now jun break Lu to broaden Qi, battle victory to make jun arrogant, break country to honor ministers, jun merit not share, then relation daily distant from jun.
translations.idiomatic: Now if you defeat Lu to enlarge Qi, victory in battle will make your ruler arrogant, destroying a state will honor your ministers, but you will share none of the merit. Your relations with your ruler will grow more distant each day.'

context.previous: 吾聞君三封而三不成者，大臣有不聽者也。
context.next: 是君上驕主心，下恣群臣，求以成大事，難矣。

translations.chinese: 是君上驕主心，下恣群臣，求以成大事，難矣。
translations.literal: This jun above arrogant jun heart, below indulge ministers, seek accomplish great matters, difficult.
translations.idiomatic: 'This will make your ruler arrogant above and indulge your ministers below. Seeking to accomplish great matters will be difficult.'

context.previous: 今君破魯以廣齊，戰勝以驕主，破國以尊臣，而君之功不與焉，則交日疏於主。
context.next: 夫上驕則恣，臣驕則爭，是君上與主有卻，下與大臣交爭也。

translations.chinese: 夫上驕則恣，臣驕則爭，是君上與主有卻，下與大臣交爭也。
translations.literal: Jun arrogant then indulgent, ministers arrogant then contend, this jun above with jun have retreat, below with ministers contend.
translations.idiomatic: 'When superiors become arrogant they become indulgent, when ministers become arrogant they contend. This means you will retreat above from your ruler and contend below with your ministers.'

context.previous: 是君上驕主心，下恣群臣，求以成大事，難矣。
context.next: 如此，則君之立於齊危矣。

translations.chinese: 如此，則君之立於齊危矣。
translations.literal: Thus, jun stand in Qi dangerous.
translations.idiomatic: 'In this way, your position in Qi will be in danger.'

context.previous: 夫上驕則恣，臣驕則爭，是君上與主有卻，下與大臣交爭也。
context.next: 故曰不如伐吳。

translations.literal: Therefore say better attack Wu.
translations.idiomatic: 'Therefore I say it is better to attack Wu.'

context.previous: 如此，則君之立於齊危矣。
context.next: 伐吳不勝，民人外死，大臣內空，是君上無彊臣之敵，下無民人之過，孤主制齊者唯君也。」

translations.chinese: 伐吳不勝，民人外死，大臣內空，是君上無彊臣之敵，下無民人之過，孤主制齊者唯君也。」
translations.literal: Attack Wu not victorious, people external die, ministers internal empty, this jun above without strong minister enemy, below without people fault, isolated jun control Qi only jun."
translations.idiomatic: 'If you attack Wu and are not victorious, your people will die abroad and your ministers will be emptied at home. This means above you will have no strong ministers as enemies, below you will have no fault from the people. The isolated ruler controlling Qi will be only you.'

context.previous: 故曰不如伐吳。
context.next: 田常曰：「善。

translations.literal: Tian Chang said: "Good.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang said: 'Good.

context.previous: 伐吳不勝，民人外死，大臣內空，是君上無彊臣之敵，下無民人之過，孤主制齊者唯君也。」
context.next: 雖然，吾兵業已加魯矣，去而之吳，大臣疑我，柰何？」

translations.chinese: 雖然，吾兵業已加魯矣，去而之吳，大臣疑我，柰何？」
translations.literal: Although, my troops already added to Lu, depart go Wu, ministers suspect me, what to do?"
translations.idiomatic: Although, my troops have already been committed to Lu. If I withdraw and go to Wu, my ministers will suspect me. What should I do?'

context.previous: 田常曰：「善。
context.next: 子貢曰：「君按兵無伐，臣請往使吳王，令之救魯而伐齊，君因以兵迎之。」

translations.chinese: 子貢曰：「君按兵無伐，臣請往使吳王，令之救魯而伐齊，君因以兵迎之。」
translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Jun hold troops not attack, subject please go make Wu wang, order him save Lu attack Qi, jun then with troops welcome him."
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'My lord should hold his troops and not attack. I will go and persuade the King of Wu to save Lu and attack Qi. My lord can then meet him with troops.'

context.previous: 雖然，吾兵業已加魯矣，去而之吳，大臣疑我，柰何？」
context.next: 田常許之，使子貢南見吳王。

translations.chinese: 田常許之，使子貢南見吳王。
translations.literal: Tian Chang permitted, made Zi Gong south see Wu wang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang agreed and sent Zigong south to see the King of Wu.

context.previous: 子貢曰：「君按兵無伐，臣請往使吳王，令之救魯而伐齊，君因以兵迎之。」

translations.chinese: 說曰：「臣聞之，王者不絕世，霸者無彊敵，千鈞之重加銖兩而移。
translations.literal: Advised: "Subject heard, wang not cut off generations, ba no strong enemy, thousand jun weight add zhu liang then move.
translations.idiomatic: He advised: 'I have heard that kings do not cut off lineages, hegemons have no strong enemies. A weight of a thousand jun will move when just a zhu liang is added.

context.next: 今以萬乘之齊而私千乘之魯，與吳爭彊，竊為王危之。

translations.chinese: 今以萬乘之齊而私千乘之魯，與吳爭彊，竊為王危之。
translations.literal: Now with ten thousand chariots Qi privately thousand chariots Lu, with Wu contend strong, secretly for wang dangerous.
translations.idiomatic: Now a Qi with ten thousand chariots is privately helping a Lu with a thousand chariots, contending with Wu for strength. I secretly consider this dangerous for your majesty.'

context.previous: 說曰：「臣聞之，王者不絕世，霸者無彊敵，千鈞之重加銖兩而移。
context.next: 且夫救魯，顯名也；

translations.literal: Moreover save Lu, manifest name;
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, saving Lu will manifest your name;'

context.previous: 今以萬乘之齊而私千乘之魯，與吳爭彊，竊為王危之。
context.next: 伐齊，大利也。

translations.literal: Attack Qi, great profit.
translations.idiomatic: 'attacking Qi will bring great profit.'

context.previous: 且夫救魯，顯名也；
context.next: 以撫泗上諸侯，誅暴齊以服彊晉，利莫大焉。

translations.chinese: 以撫泗上諸侯，誅暴齊以服彊晉，利莫大焉。
translations.literal: With pacify Si Shang feudal lords, execute violent Qi to submit strong Jin, profit none greater.
translations.idiomatic: 'With this you can pacify the feudal lords along the Si River, execute the violent Qi to submit the strong Jin. No profit could be greater.'

context.previous: 伐齊，大利也。
context.next: 名存亡魯，實困彊齊。

translations.literal: Name preserve perish Lu, reality exhaust strong Qi.
translations.idiomatic: 'In name you preserve the perishing Lu, in reality you exhaust the strong Qi.'

context.previous: 以撫泗上諸侯，誅暴齊以服彊晉，利莫大焉。
context.next: 智者不疑也。」

translations.literal: Wise not doubt."
translations.idiomatic: 'The wise do not doubt this.'

context.previous: 名存亡魯，實困彊齊。
context.next: 吳王曰：「善。

translations.literal: Wu wang said: "Good.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu said: 'Good.

context.previous: 智者不疑也。」
context.next: 雖然，吾嘗與越戰，棲之會稽。

translations.chinese: 雖然，吾嘗與越戰，棲之會稽。
translations.literal: Although, I once with Yue battle, made them dwell Kui Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Although, I once battled with Yue and made them dwell at Kuai Ji.

context.previous: 吳王曰：「善。
context.next: 越王苦身養士，有報我心。

translations.chinese: 越王苦身養士，有報我心。
translations.literal: Yue wang toil body nourish troops, has avenge me heart.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue toils and nourishes troops. He has the heart to avenge me.'

context.previous: 雖然，吾嘗與越戰，棲之會稽。
context.next: 子待我伐越而聽子。」

translations.literal: You wait me attack Yue then listen you."
translations.idiomatic: You wait for me to attack Yue, then I will listen to you.'

context.previous: 越王苦身養士，有報我心。
context.next: 子貢曰：「越之勁不過魯，吳之彊不過齊，王置齊而伐越，則齊已平魯矣。

translations.chinese: 子貢曰：「越之勁不過魯，吳之彊不過齊，王置齊而伐越，則齊已平魯矣。
translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Yue strength not exceed Lu, Wu strong not exceed Qi, wang place Qi attack Yue, then Qi already pacify Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'Yue's strength does not exceed Lu's, Wu's power does not exceed Qi's. If your majesty ignores Qi and attacks Yue, then Qi will have already pacified Lu.

context.previous: 子待我伐越而聽子。」
context.next: 且王方以存亡繼絕為名，夫伐小越而畏彊齊，非勇也。

translations.chinese: 且王方以存亡繼絕為名，夫伐小越而畏彊齊，非勇也。
translations.literal: Moreover wang just with preserve perish continue cut off as name, attack small Yue fear strong Qi, not brave.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, your majesty has just taken preserving the perishing and continuing the cut off as your name. To attack small Yue but fear strong Qi is not brave.'

context.previous: 子貢曰：「越之勁不過魯，吳之彊不過齊，王置齊而伐越，則齊已平魯矣。
context.next: 夫勇者不避難，仁者不窮約，智者不失時，王者不絕世，以立其義。

translations.chinese: 夫勇者不避難，仁者不窮約，智者不失時，王者不絕世，以立其義。
translations.literal: Brave not avoid difficulty, benevolent not poor frugal, wise not lose time, wang not cut off generations, to establish their righteousness.
translations.idiomatic: 'The brave do not avoid difficulty, the benevolent are not constrained by poverty, the wise do not lose the moment, kings do not cut off lineages—to establish their righteousness.'

context.previous: 且王方以存亡繼絕為名，夫伐小越而畏彊齊，非勇也。
context.next: 今存越示諸侯以仁，救魯伐齊，威加晉國，諸侯必相率而朝吳，霸業成矣。

translations.chinese: 今存越示諸侯以仁，救魯伐齊，威加晉國，諸侯必相率而朝吳，霸業成矣。
translations.literal: Now preserve Yue show feudal lords benevolence, save Lu attack Qi, awe add Jin state, feudal lords must lead each other court Wu, ba achievement complete.
translations.idiomatic: 'Now preserve Yue to show benevolence to the feudal lords, save Lu and attack Qi, add awe to the state of Jin—the feudal lords will surely lead each other to court Wu, and the hegemon's achievement will be complete.'

context.previous: 夫勇者不避難，仁者不窮約，智者不失時，王者不絕世，以立其義。
context.next: 且王必惡越，臣請東見越王，令出兵以從，此實空越，名從諸侯以伐也。」

translations.chinese: 且王必惡越，臣請東見越王，令出兵以從，此實空越，名從諸侯以伐也。」
translations.literal: Moreover wang must hate Yue, subject please east see Yue wang, make send troops follow, this truly empty Yue, name follow feudal lords attack."
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, your majesty must hate Yue. I will go east to see the King of Yue and make him send troops to follow. This will truly empty Yue, in name following the feudal lords to attack.'

context.previous: 今存越示諸侯以仁，救魯伐齊，威加晉國，諸侯必相率而朝吳，霸業成矣。
context.next: 吳王大說，乃使子貢之越。

translations.chinese: 吳王大說，乃使子貢之越。
translations.literal: Wu wang greatly pleased, made Zi Gong go Yue.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Wu was greatly pleased and sent Zigong to Yue.

context.previous: 且王必惡越，臣請東見越王，令出兵以從，此實空越，名從諸侯以伐也。」

translations.chinese: 越王除道郊迎，身御至舍而問曰：「此蠻夷之國，大夫何以儼然辱而臨之？」
translations.literal: Yue wang cleared road suburban welcomed, personally drove to lodge asked: "This barbarian yi country, grand master why solemnly condescend visit?"
translations.idiomatic: The King of Yue cleared the road and welcomed him in the suburbs. He personally drove to the lodge and asked: 'This is a barbarian Yi country. Why does the grand master solemnly condescend to visit it?'

context.next: 子貢曰：「今者吾說吳王以救魯伐齊，其志欲之而畏越，曰『待我伐越乃可』。

translations.chinese: 子貢曰：「今者吾說吳王以救魯伐齊，其志欲之而畏越，曰『待我伐越乃可』。
translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Now I advised Wu wang save Lu attack Qi, his will desire it but fear Yue, said wait me attack Yue then can.
translations.idiomatic: Zigong said: 'Now I advised the King of Wu to save Lu and attack Qi. His will desires it but he fears Yue, saying "Wait for me to attack Yue, then it can be done."'

context.previous: 越王除道郊迎，身御至舍而問曰：「此蠻夷之國，大夫何以儼然辱而臨之？」
context.next: 如此，破越必矣。

translations.literal: Thus, break Yue certain.
translations.idiomatic: In this way, defeating Yue is certain.'

context.previous: 子貢曰：「今者吾說吳王以救魯伐齊，其志欲之而畏越，曰『待我伐越乃可』。
context.next: 且夫無報人之志而令人疑之，拙也；

translations.chinese: 且夫無報人之志而令人疑之，拙也；
translations.literal: Moreover without avenge people will make people suspect it, clumsy;
translations.idiomatic: 'Moreover, to have no will to avenge people but make them suspect it is clumsy;'

context.previous: 如此，破越必矣。
context.next: 有報人之志，使人知之，殆也；

translations.chinese: 有報人之志，使人知之，殆也；
translations.literal: Have avenge people will make people know it, dangerous;
translations.idiomatic: 'to have the will to avenge people but make them know it is dangerous;'

context.previous: 且夫無報人之志而令人疑之，拙也；
context.next: 事未發而先聞，危也。

translations.literal: Affair not issue first heard, perilous.
translations.idiomatic: 'for affairs not yet begun to be heard beforehand is perilous.'

context.previous: 有報人之志，使人知之，殆也；
context.next: 三者舉事之大患。」

translations.literal: Three manage affair great calamity."
translations.idiomatic: 'These three are the great calamities of managing affairs.'

context.previous: 事未發而先聞，危也。
context.next: 句踐頓首再拜曰：「孤嘗不料力，乃與吳戰，困於會稽，痛入於骨髓，日夜焦脣乾舌，徒欲與吳王接踵而死，孤之願也。」

translations.chinese: 句踐頓首再拜曰：「孤嘗不料力，乃與吳戰，困於會稽，痛入於骨髓，日夜焦脣乾舌，徒欲與吳王接踵而死，孤之願也。」
translations.literal: Gou Jian knocked head twice bowed: "Gu once not measure strength, with Wu battle, trapped at Kui Ji, pain entered bone marrow, day night scorched lips dry tongue, only wished with Wu wang connect heels die, gu wish."
translations.idiomatic: Gou Jian knocked his head on the ground and bowed twice, saying: 'I once did not measure my strength and battled with Wu. I was trapped at Kuai Ji. The pain entered my bone marrow. Day and night my lips were scorched and my tongue dry. I only wished to follow close on the heels of the King of Wu and die. That was my wish.'

context.previous: 三者舉事之大患。」
context.next: 遂問子貢。

translations.literal: Then asked Zi Gong.

context.next: 子貢曰：「吳王為人猛暴，群臣不堪；

translations.chinese: 子貢曰：「吳王為人猛暴，群臣不堪；
translations.literal: Zi Gong said: "Wu wang fierce violent, ministers cannot bear;

context.next: 國家敝以數戰，士卒弗忍；

translations.literal: State depleted from frequent battles, soldiers cannot endure;

context.previous: 子貢曰：「吳王為人猛暴，群臣不堪；
context.next: 百姓怨上，大臣內變；

translations.literal: People resent superiors, ministers internally change;

context.previous: 國家敝以數戰，士卒弗忍；
context.next: 子胥以諫死，太宰嚭用事，順君之過以安其私：是殘國之治也。

translations.chinese: 子胥以諫死，太宰嚭用事，順君之過以安其私：是殘國之治也。
translations.literal: Zi Xu died remonstrating, Grand Steward Pi governs, follows jun excesses to secure his private interests: this remnant country governance.
